subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Checks that Javadoc lines efficiently utilize the available horizontal space.
subsection.p: The check focuses strictly on line length:

ul.li: Flags lines that break prematurely before the configured {@code lineLimit} when content from the following line could have been moved up.
Flags lines that exceed {@code lineLimit}, except when the line starts with an unbreakable element such as a Javadoc tag or URL.

subsection.p: Formatting concerns such as indentation, alignment, or HTML structure are intentionally ignored and should be handled by other checks.

ul.li: Empty lines (lines with no visible content)
Lines containing only a block tag header (e.g., {@code @param}, {@code @return}) with no description

Lines that start with structural HTML tags (e.g., {@code

}, {@code

    }) and contain no other text
Lines that start with a Javadoc tag or URL (these are allowed to exceed the limit)

tr.td: Target line length used to decide when Javadoc lines are too short or too long. By default this mirrors the standard maximum from the LineLength check.
Control when to print violations if the Javadoc being examined by this check violates the tight html rules defined at Tight-HTML Rules.
